message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper proposes a new similarity measure between texts, which is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science. The focus on global similarity suggests that the paper may belong to the natural language processing (NLP) sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of text corpora and experiments suggests that the paper may also be relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and deep learning (cs.DL) sub-categories.
